titleStmt.title: A declaration of the proceedings of the Kings Majesty at Carisbrooke Castle in the Isle of Wight, touching the Engagement of Sir Charles Lucas, & his farces at Colchester, with the Parliaments Army. With Another great discovery at a most horrid and bloudy design against the person of the King, shewing the manner how he should have been bereaved of his life, and his Royall blood spilt upon the ground. [Re]ad in the Honourable House of Peers, and their proceedings thereupon, touching the chiefe actor. [Li]kewise, the Lord Generalls letter to a great Commander in Colchester, and his answer thereunto, in relation to the King.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.
Dowcet, Abraham.
Rolph, Edmund.
Calum, William.

p.name: London,
p.date: printed in the year of discovery 1648.

notesStmt.note: In fact a series of letters, three of which are signed by Abraham Dowcet (p.3), Edward Rolph (p.4), and William Calum (p.6).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
